This vignette briefly shows an example of how the dummy package hello and its function `hello()` can be used in a workflow. 

## Setup

Load packages: 
```{r}
library(hello)
library(assertthat) #niet super zeker of dit hier wel moet staan, dit is de enige Imports bij DESCRIPTION package
```

## Hello function
You can use the function `hello()` to add the word *Hello* in front of a string.
For example, for the word *world*: 
```{r}
string <- 'world'

example <- hello(word = string)

print(example)
```
This gives the output `Hello world`
